property.name: dcs.tmp.dir
property.description: Temporary directory on the local filesystem. Change this setting to point to a location more permanent than '/tmp' (The '/tmp' directory is often cleared on machine restart).

property.name: dcs.local.dir
property.description: Directory on the local filesystem to be used as a local storage.

property.name: dcs.master.port
property.description: Default DCS port.

property.name: dcs.master.port.range
property.description: Default range of ports.

property.name: dcs.master.info.port
property.description: The port for the Dcs Master web UI. Set to -1 if you do not want a UI instance run.

property.name: dcs.master.info.bindAddress
property.description: The bind address for the DcsMaster web UI

property.name: dcs.master.server.restart.handler.attempts
property.description: Maximum number of times the DcsMaster restart handler will try to restart the DcsServer.

property.name: dcs.master.server.restart.handler.retry.interval.millis
property.description: Interval between Server restart handler retries.

property.name: dcs.master.listener.request.timeout
property.description: Listener Request timeout. Default 30 seconds.

property.name: dcs.master.listener.selector.timeout
property.description: Listener Selector timeout. Default 10 seconds.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.max.heap.pct.exit
property.description: Set this value to a percentage of the initial heap size (for example, value: 80), which you do not want the current heap size to exceed. When the Trafodion session disconnects, the DCS server's user program checks its current heap size. If the difference between its current and initial heap sizes exceeds this percentage, the user program will exit, and the DCS server will restart it. If the difference between its current and initial heap sizes does not exceed this percentage, the user program will be allowed to keep running. The default is 0, which means that the heap size is not checked after the session disconnects and the user program keeps running.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: User program ZooKeeper session timeout. Default 180 seconds.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.exit.after.disconnect
property.description: User program calls exit() after client disconnect. Default is 0 or don't 'disconnect after exit. Really only for developer use.

property.name: dcs.server.info.port
property.description: The port for the DcsServer web UI Set to -1 if you do not want the server UI to run.

property.name: dcs.server.info.bindAddress
property.description: The address for the DcsServer web UI

property.name: dcs.server.info.port.auto
property.description: Whether or not the DcsServer UI should search for a port to bind to. Enables automatic port search if dcs.server.info.port is already in use.

property.name: dcs.dns.interface
property.description: Dcs uses the local host name for reporting its IP address. If your machine has multiple interfaces DCS will use the interface that the primary host name resolves to. If this is insufficient, you can set this property to indicate the primary interface e.g., "eth1". This only works if your cluster configuration is consistent and every host has the same network interface configuration.

property.name: dcs.info.threads.max
property.description: The maximum number of threads of the info server thread pool. Threads in the pool are reused to process requests. This controls the maximum number of requests processed concurrently. It may help to control the memory used by the info server to avoid out of memory issues. If the thread pool is full, incoming requests will be queued up and wait for some free threads. The default is 100.

property.name: dcs.info.threads.min
property.description: The minimum number of threads of the info server thread pool. The thread pool always has at least these number of threads so the info server is ready to serve incoming requests. The default is 2.

property.name: dcs.server.handler.threads.max
property.description: For every DcsServer specified in the conf/servers file the maximum number of server handler threads that will be created. There can never be more than this value for any given DcsServer. The default is 10.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a ZooKeeper server should report its IP address.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a ZooKeeper server should use to determine the host name used by the master for communication and display purposes.

property.name: dcs.server.versionfile.writeattempts
property.description: How many time to retry attempting to write a version file before just aborting. Each attempt is seperated by the dcs.server.thread.wakefrequency milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: ZooKeeper session timeout. dcs passes this to the zk quorum as suggested maximum time for a session (This setting becomes zookeeper's 'maxSessionTimeout'). See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/current/zookeeperProgrammers.html#ch_zkSessions "The client sends a requested timeout, the server responds with the timeout that it can give the client. " In milliseconds.

property.name: zookeeper.znode.parent
property.description: Root Znode for dcs in ZooKeeper. All of dcs's ZooKeeper znodes that are configured with a relative path will go under this node. By default, all of dcs's ZooKeeper file path are configured with a relative path, so they will all go under this directory unless changed.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: Comma separated list of servers in the ZooKeeper Quorum. For example, "host1.mydomain.com,host2.mydomain.com,host3.mydomain.com". By default this is set to localhost. For a fully-distributed setup, this should be set to a full list of ZooKeeper quorum servers. If DCS_MANAGES_ZK is set in dcs-env.sh this is the list of servers which we will start/stop ZooKeeper on.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.peerport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper peers to talk to each other. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.leaderport
property.description: Port used by ZooKeeper for leader election. See http://hadoop.apache.org/zookeeper/docs/r3.1.1/zookeeperStarted.html#sc_RunningReplicatedZooKeeper for more information.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.useMulti
property.description: Instructs DCS to make use of ZooKeeper's multi-update functionality. This allows certain ZooKeeper operations to complete more quickly and prevents some issues with rare ZooKeeper failure scenarios (see the release note of HBASE-6710 for an example). IMPORTANT: only set this to true if all ZooKeeper servers in the cluster are on version 3.4+ and will not be downgraded. ZooKeeper versions before 3.4 do not support multi-update and will not fail gracefully if multi-update is invoked (see ZOOKEEPER-1495).

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.property.initLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that the initial synchronization phase can take.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.property.syncLimit
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The number of ticks that can pass between sending a request and getting an acknowledgment.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.property.dataDir
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The directory where the snapshot is stored.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.property.clientPort
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. The port at which the clients will connect.

property.name: dcs.zookeeper.property.maxClientCnxns
property.description: Property from ZooKeeper's config zoo.cfg. Limit on number of concurrent connections (at the socket level) that a single client, identified by IP address, may make to a single member of the ZooKeeper ensemble. Set high to avoid zk connection issues running standalone and pseudo-distributed.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.statistics.interval.time
property.description: Time in seconds on how often the aggregation data should be published. Setting this value to '0' will revert to default. Setting this value to '-1' will disable publishing aggregation data. The default is 60.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.statistics.cache.size
property.description: Size of cache data to be published. The default is 60.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.statistics.limit.time
property.description: Time in seconds for how long the query has been executing before publishing statistics to metric_query_table. To publish all queries set this value to '0'. Setting this value to '-1' will disable publishing any data to metric_query_table. The default is 60. Warning - Setting this value to 0 will cause query performance to degrade

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.statistics.type
property.description: Type of statistics to be published. User can set it as 'session' or 'aggregated'. By 'aggregated', only session stats and aggregation stats will be published and query stats will be published only when query executes longer than specified time limit using the property 'dcs.server.user.program.statistics.limit.time'. By 'session', only session stats will be published. The default is 'aggregated'.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.statistics.enabled
property.description: If statistics publication is enabled. The default is true. Set false to disable.

property.name: dcs.server.class.name
property.description: The classname of the DcsServer to start. Used for development of multithreaded server

property.name: dcs.server.startup.mxosrvr.user.program.restart.handler.attempts
property.description: DCS Server attempts to startup MXOSRVR times inner a configured time.

property.name: dcs.server.startup.mxosrvr.user.program.restart.handler.retry.timeout.minutes
property.description: Timeout minutes between first and max times (6 default) DCS Server startup MXOSRVR.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.tcp.keepalive.status
property.description: If tcp keepalive is enabled. The default is true. Set false to disable.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.tcp.keepalive.idletime
property.description: Time in seconds for the interval between the last data packet sent and the first keepalive probe. The default is 300.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.tcp.keepalive.intervaltime
property.description: Time in seconds for interval between two keepalive probes . The default is 3.

property.name: dcs.server.user.program.tcp.keepalive.retrycount
property.description: The maximum number of keepalive probes TCP should send before dropping the connection.
